data.title: Good Food and Pho
data.text: Good Food with prices to match.  Service was good both times we ate there on this visit.  We have eaten here before on prior trips to Reno but the food quality has improved I think.  We will be back if we are in the area and need Pho.

data.title: Solid Chinese Food
data.text: Whenever I'm in Reno without a car, I always go to Pho Mein for my Chinese food fix.  The food is on par with some of the better restaurants I have been to whether it's a side street hole in the wall in  SFO, LAX, HNL, HKT, and all points in between, tasty and authentic.  Wish they opened earlier for a hot bowl of pho for breakfast, yum.  Excellent chow fun, and bahn mi sandwiches.  Go with friends or family, order several favorite dishes and share for the best experience in Chinese cuisine.

data.title: Wonderful food, eat in or to-go to your room...
data.text: We enjoyed a number of meals with this site during our recent stay at the Eldorado.  Bahn Mi sandwich to go, Eldorado Chow Mein, the appetizer ribs, sesame chicken wings, and egg rolls were all outstanding.  The food was flavourful, and plentiful.  Will definitely eat there again!

data.title: Fast, friendly service, tasty food, but . . .
data.text:
. . . my wife and I had severe stomach distress after eating there. 

You order at a counter, get a number, and they bring you your food.  The folks taking the order were very friendly, and the food came out fast.  My wife and I had the beef chow fun and the egg rolls.  Our friend also had the beef chow fun. Both were very tasty, although our friend said the noodles were greasy.  My wife didn't like how the noodles were stuck together (not separated); she said the texture ended up being like chicken fat.  I thought everything was fine, though!

Afterwards, though, both my wife and I really did not feel well stomach-wise.  We had felt fine all day before that.  

Sadly, and despite the tasty food, I don't think we'll take a chance on Pho Mein again.

owner_response.author: P_Campitelli, F & B Coordinator at Pho Mein, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Valued Guest,

Thank you very much for taking the time to leave your comments in regards to your dining experience. I want to apologize that your expectations were not met, as those are not the expectations we set for ourselves. I will be sure to pass your feedback on to our entire team so that we can better improve our services for our guests, such as yourself. We hope that you will give us another chance in the future to host you to a true "five star" dining experience.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Noodles, Stir Fry & More
data.text: If you have a hard time finding this restaurant... Ask! Located on the Casino Level of the Eldorado Hotel... Great Food & Great Prices!

data.title: Yummm
data.text: Great Vietnamese and Chinese food! Ate beef fried rice, chow mein, grilled pork with vermicelli, and bahn mi sandwiches. All were so good. Fair prices. Best thing to eat when staying at circus circus, eldorado, or silver legacy.

data.title: My Favorite Chow Fun
data.text:
Simple, casual restaurant. You order, pay and have a seat. They bring it to your table. What is special here is the amazing Chow Fun! The chicken or the beef, either is delicious! I never miss this dish if I am near there at all and in fact I have enlisted friends to bring me an order to go-all the way home!
Build one in the East Bay please!

owner_response.author: P_Campitelli, F&B Coordinator at Pho Mein, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Valued Guest,

Thank you very much for taking the time to leave your positive comments. We work hard to offer exceptional food along with outstanding service and I am elated to hear that you had such a wonderful experience. We want to thank you for your continuous patronage and we hope to see you back again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: PHO MEIN at the Eldorado Hotel Casino
data.text: The Pho Mein at the Eldorado is located at the right side entrance off the corner of Sierra and 4th. downtown Reno. This is usually our first stop in Reno. The food is reasonable priced for a Casino Hotel.The menu is on the wall at the cashier area.The wor wonton soup was tasty with a healthy portion

data.title: Never again
data.text: While staying at the Eldorado, I decided to try this restaurant as I have not dined here in the past.  I waited in line and once approached the cash register, I placed my order.  The individual, taking the order was okay.  It took a while to receive my order, but I don't quite understand why it took that long.  I ordered the pork sweet and sour (not a usual dish for me).  When I received my order, it was as if it had been sitting on a buffet table for two days.  Much of the pork was very dark, dry and impossible to penetrate with a fork.  The rice was not fresh.  If I ever return to dine here again, I would be sure to order something that has to be freshly made, but no guarantee if it was or not so better to be safe than sorry.

owner_response.author: P_Campitelli, F & B Coordinator at Pho Mein, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Valued Guest,

Thank you very much for taking the time to leave your comments in regards to your dining experience. I want to apologize that your meal did not meet your expectations as those are not the expectations we set for ourselves. I will be sure to pass your feedback along, as we are always using this to improve our services for our guests, such as yourself. We hope that you will give us another chance in the future to host you to a true "five star" dining experience.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Outside the box
data.text: After spending a few hours gambling, we were craving some good eats.  This place was near the machines we were playing on, so we took a gander over.  They had interesting specials, but I went for the pho soup! It was delicious and they serve very generous portions.  We also had the spring rolls, which were very tasty.

data.title: fried rice
data.text: when ever we stay at the eldorado we eat at Pho Mein.The fried rice and pot stickers are a favorite of ours.Go with a group and have every one order something different,then sit at the large table with the spinner in center and place the plates on the spinner.

data.title: Good Shrimp Salad - Pho Mein, Eldorado Casino
data.text:
I enjoyed dining at Pho Mein.  One orders at the counter and then they deliver your food to your table.  The dining room is nice.

I enjoyed my shrimp salad; portion size is generous.  I had it wit a soft drink.

They give you a complementary fortune cookie with one's meal.

Pho Mein is adjacent to the casino floor at the El Dorado Casino Hotel and Resort in Reno.

data.title: Asian fast food but very good.
data.text: Lots of choices here between pho, fried noodles and rice dishes.  Mostly of the fast food type but very good.  Pretty big Asian crowd staying in the hotel for Memorial Day weekend and lots of them were at Pho Mein.  Always a good sign.

data.title: Fresh and fantastic!
data.text: We always eat here at least once when in Reno.  It is the very best Pho around - freshly made, delicious, and so tasty!

owner_response.author: P_Campitelli, Food & Beverage Coordinator at Pho Mein, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Valued Guest,

Thank you so much for taking the time to leave your positive comments. We work hard to be able to offer our guests delicious food and outstanding service and I am elated to hear that you had such an enjoyable dining experience. We look forward to hosting you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Pho and Asain Food
data.text: Ate there twice over the weekend. The food and service were very good both times. I would have given this an overall reting of 5 if not for one factor. The seafood pho used the fake crab meat, ie. flaked and formed whitefish. While it might be o.k. In a California roll, in liquid such as pho it takes on a mushy texture. Other than that, I enjoyed the food and service.

data.title: Satisfied oriental food craving
data.text: After a week of eating American food, I needed to have something else.  Pho Mein had a good selection of Chinese and Vietnamese dishes that are pretty good.  Some dishes they can make without MSG.

data.title: Great, if and when it's open
data.text: Unfortunately, it was not always open when I was wanting to have something following long days at the Big Sky Conference tournament (post 10:30 pm). Finally, on Saturday, in between championship games in the afternoon, I was able to procure and enjoy the Hong Kong style BBQ pork and noodles. I was also looking forward to Roast Duck and Noodle soup but I didn't get back there before leaving on Sunday. Maybe next year when the tournament is in Reno again!

data.title: Although I am from the San Franciso bay area with great Asian foods, I always come for the Pho Mein
data.text:
What can I say, they know how to make pho.

Everything  is fresh.  The portion is huge compared to other restaurants.  They respect the making of best broth.

Again, The casino wants to draw us in with high quality food at very reasonable price.  
However, Chinese dishes are just so so.  The Chinese dishes at Harriah  are much better.

data.title: Don’t expect top notch service
data.text: The food was good, needed more spice, but it was the service and friendliness that was lacking.  It is not a full service restaurant, you order, you sit, they bring you food.  They seemed ok when we first ordered, but when my order came, she dropped it off and left.   I was quick to realize it was not what I ordered.  I ordered the beef flank and brisket Pho, what I got was a bowl of vegetables and tofu.  I went back to the front where every cook looked at me standing there holding my full bowl, but as soon as they saw me look back, they all quickly turned away.  The runner did the same; she turned and saw me holding the trey, and walked away.  So after a few minutes the girl at the counter finished with the people she was taking an order for, and just looked at me.  I told her this was not the correct item I ordered and told her what I ordered.  She took the tray, told one of the cooks to make me what I wanted and that was it.  No apology, no we will rush it right out to you, nothing.  It did not take long and it was good, but don’t expect top notch service.

data.title: great selections
data.text: pho mein has a great selection of asian food at very affordable prices . the service is good and the servers are friendly .
